attributes.action: reform the immigration process for spouse/child entry to the UK where the sponsor spouse/parent is a British citizen
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Why must you apply for a 2 year visa for your spouse/child to enter the UK when you actually want them to gain citizenship? Why isn't there a 1 stage application that lets you gain citizenship?
I’ll tell you why – Because an average £1500 in revenue is generated per applicant for the government; for the visa to enter, then the right to stay indefinitely and finally citizenship. There is also a requirement for the applicant to supply a lot of evidence of income/expenditure etc.
Applicants are currently required to stay in the UK for 2 years and prove at the end of that period, that they have been doing so before they can obtain a right to stay. Europeans don’t have this issue because their law doesn’t believe in making married couples live apart.
There are also quite a few silly measures like the ‘Life in the UK test', which most British nationals can't pass themselves without study.
The entire process is a farce and has been implemented without thinking of the actual consequences. A ‘proper’ referendum is required and I’d be more than happy to contribute my views where there isn’t a 1000 character limit.
